com.redhat.rhn.frontend.xmlrpc

Class BaseHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.frontend.xmlrpc.BaseHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionChainHandler, ActivationKeyHandler, ApiHandler, AuthHandler, ChannelAccessHandler, ChannelHandler, ChannelOrgHandler, ChannelSoftwareHandler, ConfigChannelHandler, CrashHandler, CryptoKeysHandler, CustomInfoHandler, DistChannelHandler, ErrataHandler, FilePreservationListHandler, KeysHandler, KickstartHandler, KickstartTreeHandler, MasterHandler, OrgHandler, OrgTrustHandler, PackagesHandler, PackagesProviderHandler, PackagesSearchHandler, PreferencesLocaleHandler, ProfileHandler, ProxyHandler, RegistrationHandler, SatelliteHandler, ScheduleHandler, ServerConfigHandler, ServerGroupHandler, SlaveHandler, SnapshotHandler, SnippetHandler, SoftwareHandler, SystemDetailsHandler, SystemHandler, SystemScapHandler, SystemSearchHandler, TaskomaticHandler, TestHandler, UnitTestHandler, UserExternalHandler, UserHandler

    public class BaseHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A basic xmlrpc handler class. Uses reflection + an arbitrary algorithm to call the appropriate method on a subclass. So, an xmlrpc call to 'registration.privacy_message' might call RegistrationHandler.privacyMessage

      • providesAuthentication

        protected boolean providesAuthentication()

      • invoke

        public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.String methodCalled,
                      java.util.List params)
                        throws XmlRpcFault
        called by BaseHandler.doPost, contains the code that determines what method to call of a subclassed-object
        Parameters:
        methodCalled - the xmlrpc function called, like 'registration.privacy_statement'
        params - a Vector of the parameters to methodCalled
        Returns:
        the results of the method of the subclass
        Throws:
        XmlRpcFault - if some error occurs

      • getLoggedInUser

        public static User getLoggedInUser(java.lang.String sessionKey)
        Gets the currently logged in user. This is all done through the sessionkey we send the user in AuthHandler.login.
        Parameters:
        sessionKey - The key containing the session id that we can use to load the session.
        Returns:
        Returns the user logged into the session corresponding to the given sessionkey.

      • ensureOrgAdmin

        public static void ensureOrgAdmin(User user)
                           throws PermissionCheckFailureException
        Private helper method to make sure a user has org admin role. If not, this will throw a generic Permission exception.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to check
        Throws:
        PermissionCheckFailureException - if user is not an org admin

      • ensureOrgOrConfigAdmin

        public static void ensureOrgOrConfigAdmin(User user)
                                   throws PermissionCheckFailureException
        Public helper method to make sure a user has either an org admin or a config admin role If not, this will throw a generic Permission exception.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to check
        Throws:
        PermissionCheckFailureException - if user is neither org nor config admin.

      • ensureUserRole

        public static void ensureUserRole(User user,
                  Role role)
                           throws PermissionCheckFailureException
        Private helper method to make sure a user the given role.. If not, this will throw a generic Permission exception.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to check
        role - the role to check
        Throws:
        PermissionCheckFailureException - if user does not have the given role

        the org

      • validateEntitlements

        protected void validateEntitlements(java.util.List<Entitlement> entitlements)
        Validate that specified entitlement names correspond to real entitlements that can be changed via API (in other words, they are not permanent).
        Parameters:
        entitlements - List of string entitlement labels to be validated.

      • validateMap

        protected void validateMap(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> validKeys,
               java.util.Map map)
        Validate that the keys provided in the map provided by the user are valid.
        Parameters:
        validKeys - Set of keys that are valid for this request
        map - The map to validate

      • setEntityAttribute

        protected void setEntityAttribute(java.lang.String attrName,
                      java.lang.Object entity,
                      java.lang.Object value)
        Take an attributeName and value, and apply them to an Object. Takes advantage of introspection and bean-stds to decide what call to make
        Parameters:
        attrName - Attribute to set - assumes entity.set(value) exists
        entity - The Object we are updating
        value - The new value to pass to set
